definition:
A physical dimension such as
length, mass, force etc.
opposite_reasoning: Abstract is the strongest semantic opposite because it represents the fundamental Physical↔Abstract distinction that is core to SUMO ontology. PhysicalDimension specifically deals with measurable physical properties (length, mass, force), while Abstract encompasses non-physical, conceptual entities that cannot have physical measurements. This opposition is well-established in ontology, exists in both WordNet and SUMO, and provides clear semantic separation for Fisher-LDA. While this opposition may have moderate utility for AI safety applications (distinguishing physical from conceptual reasoning), it offers excellent opposition strength and availability.
